title: Are Key Fragments unobtainable now?
body:
I've been playing for the past 2 weeks, winning at least 100 games. But not one Key Fragment?

If this is RNG, then I must have the worst luck ever.

When I came back on League for the first time in 8 months, I got key fragments regularly and thought it was weird I wasn't getting anymore. Maybe there's a cap?

replies.body:
Key fragments drop when you win games, regardless of end game grades.

They drop in an exponentially decreasing fashion (they become less and less frequent until you barely get any)
It resets every month (every persons month is different).
Is there a way to know when mine resets?

Probably when you get one next :^)
Not officially, no. I recommend doing what BananaSlayer suggests.
Record the date when you start getting keys again, so you'll be able to keep track.

A good player has a winrate of lets say 70%, and judging by your "100 wins in 2 weeks", that means you've been playing on average 10 games per day?? How the hell do you have time for that?
Or an average player has a winrate of 50%, and that means you've played 14 games a day, how is that possible??

And yeah nah key drops are random, there was a period of time where I kept getting chests and no keys, and now i'm getting keys and no chest

Very few players have a win rate of 70%, the whole system is designed to make you have a win rate of around 50%, give or take. The more you win, the higher the level of competition you face. That's the whole point.

Now, we all get winning/losing streaks, sometimes you'll win up to 10 in a row, maybe get unlucky and lose 10 in a row, but it evens out over time. That is the point of matchmaking. This is why most players with thousands of wins in a given format, will have close to a similar number of loses.

For example, I have over 5000 games of ARAM played on this account, and I'm at like 51-52% win rate. I am unranked, but most of my ARAM games include high gold/plat/diamond players, sometimes even master or challenger.

The whole point of matchmaking, isn't so that you can aspire to 100% win rate, it's to match you with people of your own level, which will usually eventuate in around 50% wins.

That's the whole point, wtf are you on about?
